com.wm.app.b2b.server

Class ISRuntimeException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.wm.app.b2b.server.ISRuntimeException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ISRuntimeException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException

    An ISRuntimeException is thrown when a trigger service fails due to a transient error. A transient error is an error that arises from a condition that might be corrected later, such as a network issue or failure to connect to a database. When the Integration Server throws an ISRuntimeException, the server will retry the trigger service using the original input document.

    The maximum number of retries attempts and the delay between attempts can be specified using trigger properties. This exception is for use in trigger services only.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructs an ISRuntimeException without a detailed error message.

      Constructs an ISRuntimeException with the specified message.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ISRuntimeException

        public ISRuntimeException()
        Constructs an ISRuntimeException without a detailed error message.

      • ISRuntimeException

        public ISRuntimeException(java.lang.Throwable wrappedException,
                          java.lang.String msg)
        Constructs an ISRuntimeException with the specified message. Any internal exception that causes the transient error can be set as a wrappedException.
        Parameters:
        wrappedException - The exception that caused the transient error condition.
        msg - A String specifying the detailed message for this ISRuntimeException.
